intro: Salsola zygophylloides, commonly known as the desert goosefoot, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in the summer months. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access deep groundwater and survive prolonged droughts. Salsola zygophylloides is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to high temperatures and low precipitation.
